sentences.english: He found himself married to a vulgar shrew.
sentences.chinese: 他發現自己跟一個俗不可耐的悍婦結了婚。

sentences.english: His wife is a typical hellcat who always wraps him around her fingers.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子是個十足的悍婦，她總是牢牢地控制着他。

sentences.english: With an angelic face and a vixen body nobody can resist her.
sentences.chinese: 擁有天使般的面孔和悍婦般的身材沒有可以抵抗她。

sentences.english: A woman regarded as bad-tempered and evil.
sentences.chinese: 悍婦，潑婦，惡婦被認爲是脾氣很壞或邪惡的女人。

sentences.english: The story tells of a hellcat.
sentences.chinese: 這是關於一個悍婦的故事。

sentences.english: Literature language is the uncontrollable" hellcat" in the family of language.
sentences.chinese: 文學語言是語言家族中狂放不羈的浪子悍婦。

definition: lit. to destroy the bridge after crossing the river (idiom)/fig. to abandon one's benefactor upon achieving one's goal
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
to die or be martyred for a noble cause/to be faithful unto death
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
